snippet: Democrats say the Republican Party’s loss of Jewish representation is evidence of the party’s increasing homogeneity, while donors are finding other candidates eager to fill the gap.
abstract: Stinging defeat of Eric Cantor, House majority leader and highest-ranking Jewish politician in American history, has created possibility of Republicans having no Jewish representation in the House or Senate for the first time in more than a half-century; his fall, however, has been a blessing for a handful of Jewish Republican candidates who are suddenly being showered with attention from donors.
lead_paragraph: Democrats say the Republican Party’s loss of Jewish representation is evidence of the party’s increasing homogeneity, while donors are finding other candidates eager to fill the gap.

headline.main: Republican Jews Alarmed at the Prospect of a Void in the House and Senate
headline.print_headline: Republican Jews Alarmed at the Prospect of a Void in the House and Senate
